alert.note: Alert for Greenville (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 10:07AM EST until January 09 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Greenville County in upstate South Carolina... * Until 300 PM EST. * At 1007 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Remain wary of water covering roads throughout the I-85 and I-385 corridors today and pretty much anywhere throughout the northern half of Greenville County. Flooding of low-lying areas along the Reedy will worsen, affecting Unity and Cleveland Parks. Flooding of low-lying areas along Brushy Creek and in parts of the Enoree Headwaters are expected as well. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
